Utterance: <sigh>
Hi again! It’s great to see you. How have you been since our last session?
I’ve been okay, just trying to manage everything with my wife being pregnant.
That sounds like a significant change. How are you feeling about that?
Excited, but also a bit overwhelmed.
That’s understandable. It’s a big transition. Have you noticed any specific feelings or thoughts that have been challenging for you?
I guess I’ve been feeling a bit anxious about being a good dad.
Anxiety about new roles can be common. What specifically worries you about being a dad?
Just the pressure to provide and be there for my family.
It sounds like you care deeply about your family. How do you think you can prepare yourself for this new role?
I’ve been reading parenting books and talking to friends who are already parents.
That’s a proactive approach! Have you found any advice that resonated with you?
Yeah, a lot of it is about being present and supportive, which makes sense to me.
Being present is crucial. How do you plan to balance work and family time?
I’m not sure yet. I want to be there for my wife and the baby, but I also have work commitments.
It might help to set boundaries around work hours. Have you thought about how to communicate those boundaries to your employer?
I haven’t really talked to them about it yet.
That might be a good conversation to have. What do you think would be a reasonable request?
Maybe to have flexible hours for a while after the baby arrives.
That sounds reasonable. How do you feel about approaching that conversation?
A bit nervous, but I think it’s necessary.
It’s normal to feel nervous. Would it help to practice what you want to say?
Yeah, that could help.
Let’s role-play that conversation. I’ll be your employer. Ready?
Sure.
Hi! Thanks for coming in. What’s on your mind?
Um, well, I wanted to discuss my schedule once the baby arrives.
Okay, tell me more.
I’d like to request some flexibility in my hours to help support my wife and the baby.
That’s understandable. What kind of flexibility are you thinking?
Maybe starting earlier or later some days, depending on our needs.
Sounds reasonable. How do you think that will impact your work?
I believe I can still meet my deadlines and stay productive.
Great! How did that feel for you?
A bit easier than I thought.
That’s wonderful! Remember that practice can build confidence. Have you thought about any coping strategies for your anxiety?
I’ve been running more, but sometimes it’s hard to find the time.
Exercise is a great outlet. What about incorporating mindfulness or relaxation techniques?
I’ve heard of mindfulness, but I’m not really sure how to start.
Would you like to try a simple breathing exercise together?
Sure, I’d like that.
Let’s take a deep breath in through our noses... and out through our mouths.
<deep breath>
Good. Let’s do that a few more times. In... and out...
<deep breath>
How does that feel?
It feels calming, actually.
That’s great to hear! You can use this technique whenever you feel overwhelmed. How do you think you can incorporate this into your daily routine?
Maybe in the mornings before work or even at the gym.
That sounds like a good plan. Let’s set a goal for you to practice this technique daily. How does that sound?
I can do that.
Excellent! Is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
Just trying to manage my feelings about the pregnancy and work-life balance.
It’s a lot to juggle. Remember, it’s okay to ask for help. You don’t have to do it all alone.
I appreciate that.
Let’s check in on your progress next time. I’m here to support you through this transition.
Thank you, Ellie.
You’re welcome! Looking forward to our next session. Goodbye!
Bye!
